docs.title: Object
docs.description: Objects are instances of a class, with their own set of attributes and methods.
docs.longDescription: In object-oriented programming, an object is an instance of a class, with its own set of attributes and methods. A class is a blueprint for creating objects that defines their attributes and behavior. When an object is created, a special method called a constructor is called to initialize its attributes.

docs.title: Class
docs.description: Classes are blueprints for creating objects that have attributes and methods.

docs.title: Abstraction
docs.description: Abstraction is presenting complex data and functionality in a simplified and easy-to-understand way.

docs.title: Encapsulation
docs.description: Object data hidden, accessible only through designated methods, for better control and protection.

docs.title: Inheritance
docs.description: Classes can inherit attributes and methods from a parent class.

docs.title: Polymorphism
docs.description: Multiple objects can have the same method name but different implementation.

docs.title: Constructor
docs.description: A special method that is called when an object is created.

docs.title: Method
docs.description: A function that belongs to an object.

docs.title: Attribute
docs.description: A variable that belongs to an object.

docs.title: Interface
docs.description: A set of methods that define how objects of a class can be used.

docs.title: Abstract class
docs.description: A class that cannot be instantiated, but can be used as a base class for other classes.

docs.title: Static method
docs.description: A method that belongs to a class and can be called without an object instance.
